page.title: 08Camelia Botnar Foundation
page.content: Ivories Farm was bought by Mr Botnar head of Datsun UK in remembrance of his daughter{Camelia Botnar}who died in a car crash in 1978.Ivories used to be for school parties but now it is used for{unemployed school leavers. They stay at the house. There are thirteen{trainees}on the farm and eight staff. Two hundred school leavers stay there each year but most people stay there in the autumn. Mr Botnar lives in Worthing so he gets Mr Cousins to run the farm and Foundation. The{animals}they keep are a goat,a rabbit,a cat,150 cows,15 horses,150 yews and 3 rams.They own 500 acres; 300 are grass and 170 are {wheat}and barley. They have all kinds of{machines}like tractors bailers 2 combine harvesters and lots of things.Their soil is clay.They produce 80 000 eggs a year.
